channel.description: Recent content in Programming on bg

item.title: Joy of Python with Type Hints
item.description: In 2011–2017 I used Python regularly but not daily to drive small tasks and orchestration of larger programs. Moving around files, creating directories, extracting data from HTML pages and so on. In my case regular use was spread out wide enough that I always needed to lookup the docs again. Thus Python seemed a bit like a necessary evil, I did not like working with it, but alternatives like bash or perl were even worse.
